free: #e Here is a story that I heard from the elders of our tribe.
#c 這是一個我從我們部落族老們聽來的故事。
#e (It goes) not only in our Gluban tribe, but also in Nakahara and Tongan.
#c 這不僅僅是(流傳在)我們清流部落，還有中原部落和眉溪部落。
#n na is used as a particle especially when telling stories.
#n na is used as a particle especially when telling stories.
#e If we die, only our body dies.
#c 若是我們死亡，那只有我們肉體的死亡。
#e What we call “Utux (soul),” whenever it is, does not die.
#c 我們所謂的靈體，不論到何時，是不會死亡的。
#e They say, when our body dies, we go to find our ancestor’s soul and then stay together (with them) there.
#c 他們說，當我們的肉體死亡時，我們去找我們先祖的靈體，然後(跟祂們)在一起在那裡。
#c 部落的長者是這樣說的。
#e I thought about the story at that time, and said to the elderly people.
#c 我當時想一想，我對長者們說。
#e This is like going to the heaven, which is heard in the church, I thought then.
#c 這就像上教會(聽到)的上天堂，我那時候想。
#e At that time, I heard the elderly taught me.
#n ma mcahaya Dakis ga/kii「為什麼Dakis這麼做這件事？」
#n ma mcahaya Dakis ga/kii「為什麼Dakis這麼做這件事？」
#e I asked a question in reply to the elderly like this.
#e The elderly said, ‘This is not heard from the church.’
#c 族老們說：「這不是教會聽來的。」
#e They told me our own story really comes from our ancestors.
#c 他們告訴我這個我們自己的故事真的是傳自於我們的祖先。
#e Therefore I thought about this story for quite a while.
#c 因此我對這樣的話語想了好一陣子。
#e “It turns out that such story exists in our people,” I thought at that time.
#c 「原來我們有這樣的故事，」我那時候想。
#n 這裡的kari指有關宗教觀的話。
#e Therefore, I wrote down these words then.
#c 所以當時我才將這些話寫下來。
#e We Seediq, if we die, we must go through the soul bridge.
#c 我們賽德克人，如果我們身故，我們一定會行過祖靈橋。
#e Our so-called soul must go through the soul bridge.
#c 我們所謂的靈體必須行過祖靈橋。
#e When we pass the soul bridge, we must have (our) hands examined.
#c 當我們行過祖靈橋時，手一定要被檢視。
#e There will naturally be our ancestors examining (our) hands.
#c 那裡自然會有我們的祖先檢視(我們)的手。
#e Man and woman are all equal. He opens your hands.
#c 男的女的都一樣，他都打開你的手。
#e “Let’s see your hands,” he tells tou. You must let him see both your hands, instead of only one.
#c 「讓我們來看看你的手，」他跟你說。你一定要讓他看雙手，不是只有一隻。
#e Then you let him see and put (you hands) in front of him.
#c 然後你給他看，(手)放到他前面。
#n mg-dara「有血痕」；郭老師認為mg-意思是「像」。
#n mg-dara「有血痕」；郭老師認為mg-意思是「像」。

gloss: 使役-通過-受焦-2SG.屬格-3SG.主格

free: #e Whether you are a man or woman, if your hands are blood-stained, he will let you pass this soul bridge. That’s all.
#c 不論男的女的，如果你的手有血痕，他就會讓你過這座祖靈橋。就這樣。

#n putting ‘edge尾端’, a part of stick-like things (sugarcane, tobacco, scythe鐮刀) left not being completely consumed or broken, the edge of the ground (for example a house located on the north or south edge etc.)
#n tlangan「祖靈之地」，字面上是「成聚落的地方」；alang部落。

#n putting ‘edge尾端’, a part of stick-like things (sugarcane, tobacco, scythe鐮刀) left not being completely consumed or broken, the edge of the ground (for example a house located on the north or south edge etc.)
#n tlangan「祖靈之地」，字面上是「成聚落的地方」；alang部落。
#e If your hands are really blood-stained, you can go from this end to that end, and walk to the place of soul, the so-called gathering place of our ancestors.
#c 若你的手真留有血痕，你就可以從橋的這一端，到那一端，走到祖靈之地，所謂我們祖先聚集的地方。
#n ani si這裡是「但是」的意思。
#n ani si這裡是「但是」的意思。
#e However, if your hands are not blood-stained, you cannot reach the other side.
#c 但是，如果你的手沒有血痕，你就到不了對岸。
#e When you walk halfway, the bridge will shake violently.
#c 你走到中間的時候，橋會搖晃得很厲害。
